history.content: This is a good question to send to the CS advisors at cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. It's going to depend on your individual situation.

Hi, I am originally a major from another college. I’m planning to get the applications done to become an L&S student in addition to my home college sometime early this coming semester. I already completed 61A, 61B, and 70 with a 3.3 average last summer, but I did not submit a declaration application nor join L&S at the time because I wasn’t sure if I wanted to commit to a simultaneous degree, but now I am sure that it is what I want. After reading the CS declaration policies on the EECS website, I was confused if I am still allowed to apply and get approved for a CS major once I join L&S, since the website mentions that the deadline to submit the CS declaration is the semester when one completed the last of the 61AB/70 requirements, which was last summer for me. However, I’m not sure if this applies to me, since I wasn’t even in L&S at the time.

In short, as long as I complete my paperwork by the end of this coming semester, will I be able to declare L&S CS? If so, will I get the approval sometime in the next summer or will it take longer?
history.subject: Declaration questions
